str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Known, an acquaintance. From ginosko; well-known.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A sending away, a letting go, a release, pardon, complete forgiveness. From aphiemi; freedom; pardon.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To declare openly, proclaim, preach, laud, celebrate. From kata and the base of aggelos; to proclaim, promulgate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
